description: From Middle English listnynge, lustninde, from Old English hlysnende, equivalent to listen +‎ -ing.

entries.meaning: Of something or someone that listens.
examples: Any listening person can tell she's lying.

entries.meaning: Of something that is used in order to hear or to improve the ability to hear.
examples: He could hear better when he used his listening device.

entries.meaning: Of an action that is performed with caution and attention to sounds.
examples: The safest cover lay close under the wall of the cañon, and here through the dense thickets Venters made his slow, listening advance toward the oval.

description: From Middle English listnynge, lustnynge, lystenynge, equivalent to listen +‎ -ing.

examples: OK, students, today we're going to do a couple of listenings about the environment, then a reading about crime.

entries.meaning: Skill or ability of perceiving spoken language.
examples: You can improve your listening well by watching English-language films.
